means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯蒂勒普可能是职业名称，马镫制作者，来源于古英语，含义是“马镫”(stirrup)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯蒂勒普住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“马镫”(stirrup)，由附近的马镫形山岭而得名

word_mean: 镫：一种和马鞍的镫相似的结构或装置，器械内能放脚的部分

sentence.Network_en: She had to lengthen her stirrup leathers.
Jane put one foot in the near stirrup and turned to look at the stranger.
sentence.Network_cn: 简一只脚就近蹬上马镫，转脸看着陌生人。

sentence.Network_en: The stirrup leathers rubbed raw patches on his legs.
sentence.Network_cn: 马蹬皮带把他腿上的皮肤擦伤引起疼痛.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stigrāp, from the Germanic base of obsolete sty 'climb' + rope

entry.def: Stirrups are the two metal loops which are attached to a horse's saddle by long pieces of leather. You place your feet in the stirrups when riding a horse.

means.word_mean: 1. support consisting of metal loops into which rider's feet go
2. the stirrup-shaped ossicle that transmits sound from the incus to the cochlea

sentences.en: He put his feet in the stirrups.
She had to lengthen her stirrup leathers.
She stood up in her stirrups to see where the others had gone.
sentences.cn: 她脚踩马镫站起身来，想看看其他人都到哪里去了。
